intro: Bonamia latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved bonamia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. Bonamia latifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady garden environments.
